titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Walter Tittle portraits
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-05-02T11:36-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Hand-drawn portraits of American, British, Japanese, French, Italian, Belgian, and Chinese delegates to the Washington Conference on the Limitation of Armament, 1921-1922. Portraits are autographed by their subjects.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material requires at least two weeks advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter Tittle portraits, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Hand-drawn portraits of American, British, Japanese, French, Italian, Belgian, and Chinese delegates to the Washington Conference on the Limitation of Armament, 1921-1922. Portraits are autographed by their subjects.

did.unittitle: American: Warren G. Harding, President; Charles Evans Hughes, Secretary of State; Elihu Root, ex-Secretary of State; Henry Cabot Lodge, Senator; John W. Garrett, Secretary General of the Conference.

British: David Lloyd George, Prime Minister; Earl of Balfour, Minister of Foreign Affairs; Viscount Lee of Farenham, First Lord of the Admiralty; Sir Auckland Geddes, Ambassador to the U.S.; General the Earl of Cavan, Chief of the Imperial General Staff; Admiral of the Fleet Earl Beatty; Admiral Sir Ernle Chatfield; Baron Riddell of Walton Heath, Head of the Press Department; Colonel Sir Maurice Alers Hankey, Head of Secretariat for the Conference.
Canadian: Sir Robert Borden, Prime Minister.
Japanese: Admiral Baron Kato, Premier; Prince Tokugawa Iyesato, President of the House of Peers.
French: Aristide Briand, Premier; Albert Sarraut, ex-Premier; Fournier Sarloveze, Member of the Chamber of Deputies; Admiral Ferdinand H. H. de Bon.
Italian: Senatore Carlo Schanzer, Cabinet Minister; Marchese Giovanni Visconti Venosta.
Belgian: Baron de Cartier de Marchienne, Ambassador to the U.S.
Chinese: Dr. Sao-Ke Alfred Sze, Minister to the U.S.
